full_text:
Case 21-770, Document 20-2, 04/01/2021, 3068530, Page93 of 200
k7e2MaxC kjc
1  her as Scott and Janet Marshall, who both have British accents.
2  Scott Marshall told her that the -- that he was retired from
3  the British military and he was currently working on writing a
4  book. Janet Marshall described herself as a journalist who
5  wants privacy. they told the agent they wanted to purchase the
6  property quickly through a wire and that they were setting up
7  an LLC. Those conversations took place in November 2019. Your
8  Honor, following the defendant's arrest, the real estate agent
9  saw a photograph of the defendant in the media and realized
10  that the person who had introduced herself as Janet Marshall,
11  who had toured the house and participated in these
12  conversations about the purchase, was the defendant, Ghislaine
13  Maxwell.
14
15  That series of facts, which I just learned about this
16  morning, your Honor, are concerning for two reasons. First,
17  additionally, it appears that the defendant has attempted to
18  conceal an asset from the court, and at the very least she has
19  not been forthcoming in the course of her Pretrial Services
20  interview; and, second, it appears that the defendant has used
21  an alias and that she was willing to lie to hide herself and
22  hide her identity and we discussed the additional indicia in
23  our briefing your Honor. So that raises real concerns.
24
25  Moreover, the defendant's claims about her finances to
26  Pretrial Services should be concerning to the court for
27  additional reasons.

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00001034
